column3: How many years of experience do you have in your domain?
column7: I think the landing page gives a good summary of the sources of records from the selected databases.
column8: I found that all necessary details for retrieved records were available, and the export functionality in different formats (e.g., Excel, CSV, JSON) was suitable.
column9: I found the advanced filtering interface useful and comprehensive for narrowing down results.
column10: I found that the Quick and Advanced search and retrieval features consistently provided the most relevant records.
column11: I found it difficult to find specific records even after refining my search criteria.
column12: I found the multi-review page useful for identifying key record characteristics, and its links helped me drill down into detailed information on individual review pages.
column13: I could easily recover from mistakes or undo actions (e.g., advanced filtering, button clicks).
column14: I think I would like to use this system frequently, and most people would learn to use it very quickly.
column15: I found the system unnecessarily complex and very cumbersome to use.
column16: The system is intuitive, facilitating easy navigation to locate desired information.
column17: I would need the support of a technical person to use this system.
column18: I thought there was too much inconsistency in this system.
column20: The layout and organization of graphical elements are intuitive.
column21: I felt confident using the system and am very satisfied with the overall user experience.

column22: A number of filter functions do not work correctly. It is unclear what the geographical information means: is it the location of review authors, or location of primary studies? I found errors there: if you select "Uganda", a review is shown that has nothing to do with this country. I do not understand what the difference is between "data exploration" and "multiple reviews".  The "topic" filter function gives implausible results (e.g., "modelling" or "administration" give incorrect results). "Language" is not necessary because we only deal with English language reviews. "The "Summary" page shows a landscape - but this is rather irrelevant for systematic review users. Landing page: this information on sources is not necessarily what a user expects to see on a landing page: the total number of reviews is relevant, duplications from multiple sources might be relevant. Information over time is relevant.
Thank you. This tool could help me identify systematic reviews quickly. However, a reorder of some columns might increase user experience, e.g. relocate AMSTAR 2 flaws next to overall rating.
Filter options behind the filter button could be more obvious; problems with selecting a year
